1.text: Moreover the LORD answered Job, and said,

2.text: Shall he that contendeth with the Almighty instruct [him]? he that reproveth God, let him answer it.

3.text: Then Job answered the LORD, and said,

4.text: Behold, I am vile; what shall I answer thee? I will lay mine hand upon my mouth.

5.text: Once have I spoken; but I will not answer: yea, twice; but I will proceed no further.

6.text: Then answered the LORD unto Job out of the whirlwind, and said,

7.text: Gird up thy loins now like a man: I will demand of thee, and declare thou unto me.

8.text: Wilt thou also disannul my judgment? wilt thou condemn me, that thou mayest be righteous?

9.text: Hast thou an arm like God? or canst thou thunder with a voice like him?

10.text: Deck thyself now [with] majesty and excellency; and array thyself with glory and beauty.

11.text: Cast abroad the rage of thy wrath: and behold every one [that is] proud, and abase him.

12.text: Look on every one [that is] proud, [and] bring him low; and tread down the wicked in their place.

13.text: Hide them in the dust together; [and] bind their faces in secret.

14.text: Then will I also confess unto thee that thine own right hand can save thee.

15.text: Behold now behemoth, which I made with thee; he eateth grass as an ox.

16.text: Lo now, his strength [is] in his loins, and his force [is] in the navel of his belly.

17.text: He moveth his tail like a cedar: the sinews of his stones are wrapped together.

18.text: His bones [are as] strong pieces of brass; his bones [are] like bars of iron.

19.text: He [is] the chief of the ways of God: he that made him can make his sword to approach [unto him].

20.text: Surely the mountains bring him forth food, where all the beasts of the field play.

21.text: He lieth under the shady trees, in the covert of the reed, and fens.

22.text: The shady trees cover him [with] their shadow; the willows of the brook compass him about.

23.text: Behold, he drinketh up a river, [and] hasteth not: he trusteth that he can draw up Jordan into his mouth.

24.text: He taketh it with his eyes: [his] nose pierceth through snares.
